title: 1Password integration doesn't fetch username and password for RDP connection
author: jonashilmersson
body_snippet:
I'm running Windows 11, 1Password for Windows 8.12.0 (81200013) and mRemoteNG 1.78 Nightly build 3228. 

I've activated 1P CLI and tested it out in the terminal, it works fine. 

I've created a RDP connection using IP address, set it to use 1Password as the External Credential Provider. In the API User ID field, I've written 

`op://My Vault/My RDP item`

When I try to connect, I get the normal Windows login dialog with the username prefilled, just like if I use the normal Windows RDP client. I'...

comments.author: jonashilmersson
comments.snippet:
I now also tried to change the username in 1P, and the change doesn't get picked up, so I suspect that the "read" from 1P doesn't work at all.

How do I see the logs for this?

comments.author: jonashilmersson
comments.snippet:
After some further investigations, I found out the following:

* My vault name contains a space which breaks the code that parses the input string by converting it to an Uri. As the vault name comes as a "domain", it's not valid.
* The password is returned as a field without a value for purpose and of type CONCEALED, so it's not found by the FindField function.

comments.author: jonashilmersson
comments.snippet: Hi again, I've created a fix for this but I'm not allow to push a new branch. I've looked through your contribute docs but didn't find anything that helped me to make it work. My branch is based on the `v1.78.2-dev` branch which seems to be the most current, and I named it `bug/1p-integration-not-working`.

Hey @jonashilmersson 

What would be your reason to create a new branch within this project? I would have suggested you just create a pull request directly to the dev branch and then we'll ...

comments.author: jonashilmersson
comments.snippet: Hi @simonai1254 , as far as I can see, the 1Password integration was added in this [commit](https://github.com/mRemoteNG/mRemoteNG/commit/1b55645b81c2687055c52da32480b0b891682f4e) from Oct 8th 2025, and the develop branch hasn't had a commit since Aug 15th 2023 so the 1Password integration doesn't exist there. I can rebase on develop if you update the develop branch.

comments.author: simonai1254
comments.snippet:
Hey Jonas

I'm confused, what would be your preferred target branch? I would have expected it to be pulled back into the 1.78.2-dev branch, but @Kvarkas might now a little better. In the end the pull request can always be redirected, so I would just create it that way for now...

comments.author: jonashilmersson
comments.snippet: I guess it depends on how you work in the project. I just used the 1.78.2-dev branch as target as that was the latest with the 1P integration. But as of now, I don't have permissions to push my branch.

comments.author: robertpopa22
comments.snippet:
Update:

- Fix is proposed in upstream PR:
  - https://github.com/mRemoteNG/mRemoteNG/pull/3107

Scope includes robust `op://` parsing for vault/item names with spaces and `CONCEALED` fallback field handling.

comments.author: robertpopa22
comments.snippet:
Covered by upstream PR:&echo https://github.com/mRemoteNG/mRemoteNG/pull/3107
&echo Fork CI evidence:&echo https://github.com/robertpopa22/mRemoteNG/actions/runs/21782320844

comments.author: robertpopa22
comments.snippet:
✅ Fix available in community release: https://github.com/robertpopa22/mRemoteNG/releases/tag/v1.79.0

**PR:** #3107 | **Branch:** `codex/pr3-onepassword-3092`
**Fix:** 1Password credential parser and fallback handling corrected.

3 platform builds (x64, x86, ARM64) available for download.
